title: 1017 ALYX 9SM
subtitle: 1017 ALYX 9SM x Nike Zip Hoodie
brand_description: With over a decade of experience in the streetwear, music, and art industries, Been Trill co-founder and frequent Nick Knight collaborator Matthew M. Williams launched his womenswear label 1017 ALYX 9SM in 2015. Emerging in Spring/Summer 2017, the brand’s debut menswear collection rises as a collaboration with Japanese brand ‘fragment design.’ Channeling the same downtown spirit and youthful subversion that colors his women’s line, bold text and embroidered graphics round out the 1017 ALYX 9SM's collection of unconventional basics. Slim cashmere gabardine trousers and crisp button-up shirts blend seamlessly with streamlined tailoring and workwear silhouettes, while subtle details and embroidered graphics adorn supple leather trousers, utility backpacks, and the label's signature rollercoaster belt.

title: Acne Studios
subtitle: Karlos Multi Jacquard Knit
brand_description: Ambition to Create Novel Expression” – this acronym forms the mission statement of Acne Studios, a creative collective and lifestyle brand that started off in Stockholm in 1996 with 100 pairs of minimalist raw denim jeans. Founder and creative director Jonny Johansson distributed the jeans to his friends in the Swedish creative community, and demand for the brand’s novel and pared-back vision grew from there. Now comprising arms focusing on design, production, and advertising, the collective’s fashion division split off independently in 2006. Its menswear offerings present a wardrobe of understated yet distinctive basics updated with perfected proportions and nuanced colorways. Leather and shearling jackets, well cut denim, progressive tailored pieces, and pared-back knits, button-downs, and t-shirts all reflect Johansson’s intellectual take on Scandinavian minimalism.

title: Aime Leon Dore
subtitle: Stripe Rugby Shirt
brand_description: Following the unequivocal success of their initial 2014 launch, New York City-based fashion and lifestyle brand Aimé Leon Dore has continued to expand their expertise in fresh yet timeless design. Drawing largely on founder Teddy Santis’ nostalgic memories of growing up in Queens, the label owes its signature high-low blend of urban and tailored essentials to the cultural confluence of the borough from which it sprung. With influences ranging from graffiti kids to basketball stars, well-considered details and unusual combinations put a novel spin on menswear favorites. Trench coats and bombers layered with streetwear staples like hoodies and t-shirts result in an unexpectedly elevated aesthetic, utility jackets and colorblocked windbreakers deliver refined utilitarian appeal.

title: Alexander McQueen
subtitle: Classic Jersey Skull Crew Sweatshirt
brand_description: As Alexander McQueen’s right-hand confidant up until his 2010 passing, Sarah Burton’s intuitive understanding of the titular designer’s vision is imparted in the label’s latest menswear offerings. Evoking brazen histrionics and soft-spoken intimacy in the same breath, the McQueen label’s romanticized brutalism guides the geographically-specific set-pieces parenthesizing their impeccably crafted men’s collections. While the brand’s unmistakeable trademarks are laid bare across their menswear line, an intangible allure is sustained by Burton’s esoteric reference points. Building on a legacy that has long eluded generic classification, the McQueen culture thrives on the juxtaposition between contrasting elements: fragility and strength, tradition and modernity, fluidity and severity. By effortlessly honoring the legacy of its namesake, Sarah Burton weaves the Alexander McQueen label’s somberly theatrical atmosphere into stately yet approachable menswear.

title: Ambush
subtitle: Waves Tie Dye Tee
brand_description: AMBUSH® is a contemporary japanese jewelry label founded by japanese designers VERBAL and YOON, in 2008. The label has partnered with a variety of influential street brands and designers including A Bathing Ape®, NIGO, Maison Kitsune, sacai and UNDERCOVER.

title: APC
subtitle: Contrast Zip Bomber Jacket
brand_description: Started in 1988 by creative director Jean Touitou, A.P.C. (short for Atelier de Production et de Creation) produces timeless, quintessentially Parisian men’s ready-to-wear. Refined materials and an attention to cut and fit define the label’s elevated closet staples, from its cult favorite raw denim jeans and mariner striped sweaters to printed button-downs and t-shirts. Timelessly styled leather and suede backpacks, desert boots, and derbys complement A.P.C.’s low-key menswear for a look that is casual, yet always polished.

title: Billionaire Boys Club
subtitle: Tree Camo All Over Print Tee
brand_description: It’s no new thing for fashion designers to use bits and pieces of classic Americana in their work—a little bit of cowboy swagger here, some blue-collar workwear there, all sprinkled with military influence on top, and voilà: Fashion! Designer Holly Jovenall, who grew up on a farm outside of Pittsburgh and spent the early part of her career working at iconic early-aughts L.A. boutiques like Kitson, takes similar inspirations but comes up with a different result. Her brand, Billy Los Angeles, reimagines those menswear standbys with a darker, moodier attitude. In some ways, it makes her label feel perfectly in tune with the times, where masculinity and American identity are at a cultural crossroads. But Jovenall’s work emanates less from the political than the personal—pieces like her Carhartt-indebted work jacket spring from memories of her small-town childhood, flecked with nostalgia. To wit: The brand is named after her father.

title: Billy Reid
subtitle: Knit Crewneck
brand_description: Worn by James Bond in 2012's Skyfall. During a recent chat with Esquire, Alabama-based designer Billy Reid shared his eponymous clothing brand's mission statement by way of his thoughts on today's menswear market, "There's so much stuff out there. You can buy anything you want, any time you want it. So more and more our philosophy has been we want to make fewer things, better things, more special things, more meaningful things." That approach is apparent in each new piece of Billy Reid's award-winning range. With fall officially here, we teamed up with Billy on some of the season’s essential garments. Like the crewneck Dover Sweatshirt that Billy sewed handsome leather elbow patches to, so it’ll last you for years. And the soft, durable Denim Shirt—with a black garment dye to give it much greater versatility than your average overshirt. While Billy may be aiming to make fewer things, when they’re this well made we'll happily line up for each and every one of 'em.

title: Blackeyepatch
subtitle: Nylon Track Jacket
brand_description: Based in Tokyo, BlackEyePatch stickers erode all over the world. In the media, BlackEyePatch, which was often categorized as a "mystery sticker group," uses "Tokyo" as its identity, and after merchandising item development, it now develops a full lineup of collections. Inspired by a variety of street-rooted cultures, BlackEyePatch has shifted its focus on fashion to a new development.

title: Carhartt WIP
subtitle: Goodwin Track Jacket
brand_description: Carhartt Work in Progress offers a refined and acutely tailored translation of the classic American heritage brand. The label’s story begins in Detroit where Hamilton Carhartt founded the workwear brand in 1889 with the core principle of building a 'just and honest' company. His vision of Carhartt carries on today both in principle and aesthetic, leading to Work in Progress’ initial distribution in the nineties of a selection of original workwear garments tailored for a European market. Carhartt’s trademark duck canvas in its signature ‘Hamilton’ brown is both durable and an instant signifier of the brand’s founding ethos of quality craftsmanship meeting the highest standards of wearability. Carhartt WIP offers updated silhouettes of trademark classics, including straight-leg or slim-fit trousers and overalls, lightweight quilted bomber jackets, and classic raglan sleeve hoodies with flatlock stitching for optimum durability. With pieces that flow freely between utilitarian, streetwear, and skate culture, the label’s logo remains a characteristic symbol of an all things American. Shifting from working class to varsity leanings, the collection’s pieces are by no means identity-limiting. Carhartt WIP offers an aesthetic that allows for the modern man to either reinforce or reinterpret the definition of Americana by way of a more expansive and progressive outlook on contemporary men’s fashion.

title: Carhartt WIP
subtitle: Goodwin Track Jacket
brand_description: Carhartt Work in Progress offers a refined and acutely tailored translation of the classic American heritage brand. The label’s story begins in Detroit where Hamilton Carhartt founded the workwear brand in 1889 with the core principle of building a 'just and honest' company. His vision of Carhartt carries on today both in principle and aesthetic, leading to Work in Progress’ initial distribution in the nineties of a selection of original workwear garments tailored for a European market. Carhartt’s trademark duck canvas in its signature ‘Hamilton’ brown is both durable and an instant signifier of the brand’s founding ethos of quality craftsmanship meeting the highest standards of wearability. Carhartt WIP offers updated silhouettes of trademark classics, including straight-leg or slim-fit trousers and overalls, lightweight quilted bomber jackets, and classic raglan sleeve hoodies with flatlock stitching for optimum durability. With pieces that flow freely between utilitarian, streetwear, and skate culture, the label’s logo remains a characteristic symbol of an all things American. Shifting from working class to varsity leanings, the collection’s pieces are by no means identity-limiting. Carhartt WIP offers an aesthetic that allows for the modern man to either reinforce or reinterpret the definition of Americana by way of a more expansive and progressive outlook on contemporary men’s fashion.

title: Columbia
subtitle: Monashee Anorak - Multi
brand_description: For more than 80 years, Columbia Sportswear Company has been making gear for people who enjoy the outdoors in the Pacific Northwest and far beyond. Chairman Gert Boyle has been at the helm for nearly 50 of those years and her Tough Mother persona helped grow Columbia into the global sportswear brand it is today. We’re still based in Portland, Oregon and still making no-nonsense apparel, footwear, and accessories to keep you warm, dry, cool, and protected no matter what. Our innovative gear, Pacific Northwest heritage, irreverent spirit, and family business ethos is what sets us apart.

title: Heron Preston
subtitle: Long Sleeve Over NASA Facts Tee
brand_description: Parsons School of Design alumnus Heron Preston is unquestionably a creative Renaissance man. Following a move from his native San Francisco to New York City, the artist, DJ, and clothing designer launched his career by founding streetwear and art direction collective Been Trill alongside 1017 ALYX 9SM’s Matthew Williams and Off-White’s Virgil Abloh. Following the release of his ‘NASCAR’ t-shirt, which reinterpreted iconic trademarks into an over-branded visual feast, Preston was inspired to further explore the value and meaning of authenticity in today’s sartorial landscape. An eye-opening experience then prompted him to turn a critical eye to the garment industry’s role in the global pollution crisis. Producing a sustainable capsule collection in collaboration with the NYC Department of Sanitation, he demonstrated that environmental awareness and fresh aesthetics need not be mutually exclusive. Preston’s eponymous streetwear label, launched in 2016, propels his unique worldview with a reference-rich collection steeped in internet, youth, and counterfeit culture.

title: John Elliott
subtitle: Long Sleeve Double Dye University Tee
brand_description: American designer John Elliott founded his namesake brand of menswear in 2012, the result of Elliott resolving what was missing from his own wardrobe. Elliott’s focus on creating clothes from unique fabrics in fashionably functional designs, wholly classic yet undeniably modern, inspire the meticulous approach to development that results in the clothes’ unequivocal quality: fabrics are sourced and developed in Japan; French terry fabrics are custom-knit in the United States to precise specifications; zippers, the ultimate functional feature, are sourced from Riri in Switzerland. Finally, John Elliott’s collections are produced in Los Angeles, California under the designer’s care.

title: Kappa
subtitle: Taped Anniston Track Top
brand_description: Kappa Kontroll, created in 1956 almost by chance, reinterprets a street perspective of iconic items from the label’s performance apparel line of the early 80’s, when Kappa changed its positioning and become an international sports brand.

title: Kith
subtitle: Kith x New Balance Quarter Zip Nylon Windbreaker Track Top
brand_description: KITH is a retail store based in NYC, founded by sneaker designer, Ronnie Fieg in 2010. It currently has two New York locations in Manhattan and Brooklyn, as well as an online store. KITH sells a range of its own apparel alongside footwear collaborations, as well as a number of renowned streetwear brands. Many of Fieg’s sneaker collaborations bearing the KITH name have proved popular, leading to recurring sneaker collaborations with the likes of PUMA, ASICS, New Balance and more.

subtitle: Kith x New Balance Quarter Zip Nylon Windbreaker Track Top

title: Martine Rose
subtitle: Collection Date Crew Sweatshirt
brand_description: Showcasing a subversive vision, London-based label Martine Rose draws inspiration from elements of the early 90s-era rave and hip hop culture and proposes a transgressive range of reinterpreted menswear staples. Oversized French terry hoodies, sweatshirts, and bonded cotton shirts are blown-out into exaggerated proportions. Signature wide-leg jeans, billowing cord trousers, and denim jackets make a strong statement. Nylon flight jackets and athletic windbreakers are rendered in deconstructed silhouettes. Embroidered patches, cursive logos, and striped rib knit trims elevate to soccer shirts and basic tees. Unexpected draping, ruching, and cut-out accents reveal the label’s discerning eye for detail.

title: Martine Rose
subtitle: Date Long Sleeve Tee

title: Nike
subtitle: Sherpa Wind Runner
brand_description: Global footwear giant Nike began in 1963 as a small-scale business venture between University of Oregon runner Phil Knight and his coach, Bill Bowerman. Initially operating as an Onitsuka Tigers importer, personal ambition led Knight and Bowerman to begin designing their own sneakers under the Nike moniker in 1970. Defined by a distinctive waffle outsole, the duo’s creations quickly gained market momentum - Nike Air technology was patented in 1979, enabling creation of the wildly popular Air Force 1 in 1982, and an endorsement deal signed with Michael Jordan in 1984 put the brand on the path to becoming an enduring pop culture phenomenon. Today, Nike retains a coveted top spot in the streetwear and athletic wear markets, staying on the cutting edge of materials research, and refreshing its relevancy with vital collaborations from Supreme to Comme des Garçons.

title: Nike ACG
subtitle: Primaloft Jacket
brand_description: Nike ACG (All Conditions Gear) is a subsidiary line of Nike that produces innovative athletic apparel and sports gear for all climates. Debuting in 1989, Nike ACG widened their scope of outdoors-oriented sneakers that was true to its name. The ACG line built up a cult-like following with its non-commercial, off-the-wall image, bold colorways, and silhouettes which have since inspired sneakerheads for decades, such as the Air Mowabb, Air Mada, and the Air Escape.

title: Noon Goons
subtitle: Max Dyed This Tee
brand_description: Founded by Mr Kurt Narmore, Noon Goons is influenced by Southern California’s surf, skate and punk rock scenes. The casual streetwear range is designed in Los Angeles and exudes youthful rebellion. Graphic prints are a signature.

subtitle: Norse Projects x Daniel Frost Standing Skier Tee
brand_description: Norse Projects, the established Copenhagen-based boutique, released its eponymous line in 2004. With its roots in skateboarding and inspiration from Danish design, the brand specialises in modern wardrobe staples that eschew trends. Don’t miss the classic rain macs.

title: Nothin Special
subtitle: Crazy Best Tee
brand_description: Nothin'Special is a streetwear label based in New York City and Hailing from Japan. Their brand's name is influenced by street subcultures that often times seem to be created out of Nothing. The brand's line conveys New York street style with the quality of Japan. "Built Something Out Of Nothing"

title: Opening Ceremony
subtitle: Zip Off Wind Jacket
brand_description: Opening Ceremony began as the in-house brand of the NYC boutique founded by Humberto Leon and Carol Lim in 2002. Since its beginnings as a "basics-plus" collection of monochrome knitwear, it has expanded into a design leader whose simple yet timeless silhouettes are always approached with a fresh outlook. Ongoing partnerships with designers including Chloe Sevigny, Tretorn, Pendleton and Levi's reflect Opening Ceremony's founding belief in collaboration and creativity.

title: Reebok
subtitle: Reebok x PLEASURES Vector Anorak
brand_description: Few sportswear brands have established a cult status quite like Reebok Classics. Founded as an athletic footwear company in 1895, Reebok has supplied essential sneakers while keeping stylistically up to speed: signature collaborations with not just athletes but artists, from Jay-Z to Kendrick Lamar, lend the label a subcultural edge in addition to its timeless look. For its collection of womenswear, Reeboks Classics redefines stalwart styles from joggers to high tops in an ever-expanding array of colorways.

title: Reebok
subtitle: Reebok x PLEASURES Vector Anorak

title: Saturdays NYC
subtitle: Poster Gradient Tee
brand_description: Following their respective professional journeys at J. Lindberg, Acne, and Esquire, co-founders Josh Rosen, Colin Tunstall, and Morgan Collett established Saturdays NYC in 2009. What began as a humble t-shirt line has since matured into a multi-faceted lifestyle brand featuring a curated ready-to-wear line, an eponymous print magazine, and a coffee shop. Drawing upon their shared passion for surf culture, art, and fashion, the New York-based design trio’s range of easy-to-wear wardrobe essentials threads a line between laid-back refinement and modern design. Limited edition graphic tees, performance board shorts, shearling-trimmed denim jackets, and canvas slip-on sneakers echo the label’s NYC downtown cool aesthetic. Sharp poplin oxford shirts, quilted bomber jackets, and timeless cotton-twill chinos remain go-to staples. Embroidered panelled caps and knit beanies play up the brand’s East Coast urban spirit while small understated leather goods including wallets and zip pouches are both luxurious and functional.

title: Saturdays NYC
subtitle: Middle Script Tee
brand_description: Following their respective professional journeys at J. Lindberg, Acne, and Esquire, co-founders Josh Rosen, Colin Tunstall, and Morgan Collett established Saturdays NYC in 2009. What began as a humble t-shirt line has since matured into a multi-faceted lifestyle brand featuring a curated ready-to-wear line, an eponymous print magazine, and a coffee shop. Drawing upon their shared passion for surf culture, art, and fashion, the New York-based design trio’s range of easy-to-wear wardrobe essentials threads a line between laid-back refinement and modern design. title: SOPHNET
subtitle: Box Logo Tee
brand_description: SOPHNET. is a japanese streetwear brand, founded by Hirofumi Kiyonaga, in 1998. The brand itself is under the concept of minimal design, focusing on creating a collection of functional casual clothes for daily use. SOPHNET. has also collaborated with brands such as Vans, Stussy and Nike, as well as artists such as Julian Opie, Tatsuo Miyajima and Jack Pierson.

title: Stussy
subtitle: Stock Crew Tee
brand_description: Laguna Beach local and cult surfboard-shaper Mr Shawn Stüssy set up his label in 1980 inspired by DIY culture and the boundary-blurring music scene of the time. The cult brand continues to produce an effortlessly cool range of products which draw on global travel and the art world. Cult Californian label High-quality casualwear Packed with attitude

title: Y-3
subtitle: Long Sleeve Chest Logo Tee
brand_description: October 2002 saw the birth of the most influential cooperation in sport and fashion to date with the launch of the Spring/Summer 2003 Y-3 mens and women's collections. The partnership between renowned Japanese fashion designer, Yohji Yamamoto and authentic sports brand, Adidas, has revolutionized the industry. The "Y" stands for Yohji Yamamoto, the "3" represents the signature Adidas three stripe logo and the "-" signifies the link between the two. Adidas represents sport, Yohji Yamamoto represents design, and both symbolize true craftsmanship. Together they have developed the future in sportswear.
